name: CREATE
description: CREATE was a student led engingeering society at the University of New South Wales. CREATE aimed at making engineering skills more accessible to everyone. It held weekly workshops for software and electrical, created and sold beginner kits for arduinos and ran engineering projects such as participating in Sydney VIVID lights festival every year.

name: Crystalise Vivid 2017
description: Crystallize is a Sydney Vivid light show project.

name: Maker Mentor at the Michael Crouch Innovation Centre (MCIC)
description: The MCIC was a maker space created for students and open to public. As a maker mentor, I had the responsibility to be trained in using equipments such as the laser cutter, 3d printers and the CNC. I'm also the person watching over the space during my volunteering hours to enjoy the safety of others and can provide consultation for people's innovations.

name: Maker games
description: Albert for the blind was a hackathon project at improving accessibility to payment devices
